result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett P Armbruster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders 9 days sentence credit to be applied in lieu of payment towards costs and DNA surcharge ($443). Paid in full.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
09:17 AM Defendant Brett P Armbruster in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to proceed to Plea and Sentencing. Court conducts colloquy with defendant.    Court makes a finding of guilt and enters judgment on the previously entered plea.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.  

The Court Orders the Following:

**COUNT 1**

75 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS. (Credit - 75 days).  **TIME SERVED.**

FINE or COSTS: $243.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
9 DAYS CREDIT TO BE APPLIED TO FINE/COSTS AND DNA SURCHARGE IN LIEU OF PAYMENT.

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

01:42 PM Defendant Brett P Armbruster in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew Herbers appeared stating the defendant refused a public defender interview today.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant states he would like to be added to the Public Defenders list.  Attorney Herbers states they will put the defendant on their list.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Court sets matter for status of counsel as soon as possible before the trial court.
